Because of the strange shape,
when you're laying that out to cut the fabric,
there was a lot of waste, the big pieces of waste.

Can we do something with that?

Let's make a little, a little waist bag.
And so I drew up a little waist bag an hour later that we, we done it.
There was the first prototype of what was be urban Fanny.
And so we took that urban Fanny and we looked at it and we put it
on the bottom of the Sebring, and the Sebring just became finished.
The Sebring looked cute, but we put this urban fanny
on, on, on it as a little extra external pocket.
And the design just became yeah, it just became something more amazing.
And so that would be the first example of, of,
of recycling factory waste
and turning it into a product and then having that product
adorn another product and make it even better.
So that was a cool story.
